isa_json.title: A large-scale multicenter breast cancer DCE-MRI benchmark dataset with expert segmentations
isa_json.description: A multicenter dataset (MAMA-MIA) of 1506 pre-treatment T1-weighted dynamic contrast-enhanced MRI (DCE-MRI) cases, including expert annotations of primary tumors and non-mass-enhanced regions. The dataset integrates imaging data from four collections in The Cancer Imaging Archive (TCIA). Preliminary segmentations generated by a deep learning model were corrected and verified by 16 breast cancer experts, resulting in a fully annotated dataset. The resource includes 49 harmonized clinical and demographic variables, 22 imaging parameters, and pre-trained weights for a baseline nnU-Net model, serving as a benchmark for advanced deep learning models in breast cancer diagnostics and treatment response prediction.

studies.title: MAMA-MIA Dataset Construction and Expert Annotation

assays.name: DCE-MRI Tumor Segmentation and Quality Control Pipeline

steps.name: Data Sourcing and Initial Filtering
steps.description: Collect pre-treatment T1-weighted DCE-MRI cases from four public TCIA collections (I-SPY1, I-SPY2, DUKE, NACT) that underwent Neoadjuvant Chemotherapy (NAC) and had corresponding clinical data (pCR or survival status) available.

steps.name: Initial Image Quality Control (QC)
steps.description: Experts excluded cases lacking sufficient contrast enhancement or those with artifacts that significantly impeded accurate cancer segmentation, resulting in the final 1506 cases for the MAMA-MIA dataset.

steps.name: Data Harmonization and Standardization
steps.description: Consolidate and harmonize 21 clinical variables, 6 demographic variables, and 22 imaging parameters into a single table. Standardize the dataset folder structure, file naming, and image orientation (Axial MRIs to LAS, Sagittal MRIs to PSR) for computational analysis.

steps.name: Volume of Interest (VOI) Definition
steps.description: Define a 3D rectangular bounding box (VOI) manually drawn to encompass the entire enhanced region (primary tumor or non-mass-enhanced area). Functional Tumor Volume (FTV) analysis masks were used where available, or approximate VOIs were created using filtering steps on SER/PE images.

steps.name: Preliminary Segmentation Model Training
steps.description: Train a standard nnU-Net deep learning model using 331 external expert segmentations (from DUKE and TCGA-BRCA) on cropped VOIs, preprocessed with resampling to 1x1x1 mm³ isotropic pixel spacing.

steps.name: Preliminary Automatic Segmentation Generation
steps.description: Generate preliminary automatic segmentations for all 1506 cases using the trained nnU-Net model. Segmentations were up-sampled and mapped back to the original image space.

steps.name: Visual Quality Control (QC) of Automatic Segmentations
steps.description: Two expert breast radiologists visually assessed all 1506 preliminary automatic segmentations using a GUI, categorizing them into four quality categories: Good, Acceptable, Poor, or Missed.

steps.name: Expert Manual Correction and Verification
steps.description: 16 breast cancer experts manually corrected and verified the preliminary automatic segmentations for all 1506 cases using the Mango viewer. Experts were instructed to segment only the primary lesion within the VOI.

steps.name: Baseline Model Training and Weight Release
steps.description: Train a baseline nnU-Net model using the final 1506 expert segmentations (full images, 5-fold cross-validation) and release the pre-trained weights as an additional contribution.

steps.name: Metric Calculation
steps.description: Compute the Dice Similarity Coefficient (DSC) and 95 percentile Hausdorff Distance (HD) between the preliminary automatic segmentations and the final expert segmentations.
